The claim originated from a YouTube vide: UFOmania - The truth is out there" on 2 April 2017.
The script and photographs used in the v: com on 1 April 2017, which is commonly known as April Fool's Day.
The article on experiencecadescove: com explicitly stated that the story was an April Fool's Day joke and that there are no subterranean cities beneath the Smoky Mountains.
The article included an image of a tweet: GSMNPNews, which was proven to be fake as the actual account used by the Great Smoky Mountains National Park is @GreatSmokyNPS.
